Event.name: Transitive_action
Event.definition: <def-root>This frame characterizes, at a very abstract level, an <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> affecting a <fen>Patient</fen>. This frame is inherited by many lower-level frames. </def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Agent</fen> is the entity that acts on another entity. </def-root>

Arg.name: Patient
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Patient</fen> is the entity that is being acted on and that may but need not undergo a change. </def-root>

Arg.name: Event
Arg.definition: <def-root>An <fen>Event</fen> in which an <fen>Agent</fen> acts on an entity.</def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Depictive</fen> phrase describing a participant in the event. </def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An act performed by an <fen>Agent</fen> that enables them to act upon the <fen>Patient</fen>.</def-root >

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). </def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> at which the event takes place.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The location at which the event takes place.</def-root>

Arg.name: Cause
Arg.definition: <def-root>An event which causes the <fen>Patient</fen> to be affected in some way.</def-root>
